intro: Litsea deplanchei, commonly known as the Mexican-laurel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its aromatic, glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, woody drupe that contains a single seed. Litsea deplanchei is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests.
